intro: Cephalophora collina, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreen plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the tips of its branches. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests or high-altitude grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
